name: 50/30/20 Rule
definition: A popular rule of thumb in personal budgeting that allocates income into three categories: 50% to "needs," 30% to "wants," and 20% to "savings or debt payment."

name: Amortization
definition: The process of paying off debt by spreading it out into regular fixed payments that include principal and interest.

name: Capital Gains
definition: Profits derived from selling capital assets such as financial investments, real estate, personal property, or collectibles.

name: Common Stocks
definition: The category of stock held by the majority shareholders, which gives them an ownership stake in the company and, in most cases, voting rights.

name: Compound Interest
definition: The interest on a loan or deposit that is based on the original principal amount borrowed or invested as well as the accumulated interest from previous periods.

name: Cosigner
definition: A person who agrees to assume responsibility for repaying a loan if the borrower doesn't pay.

name: Credit Score
definition: A number between 300 and 850 that represents your creditworthiness, derived by taking into account factors like payment history, credit mix, and the total amount you owe.

name: Deductable
definition: A fee paid out of pocket by a policyholder before an insurance company compensates for a claim.

name: Dividend
definition: A periodic payment made to investors who own stock in a company, fund, or partnership, as a way to distribute earnings.

name: FHA Mortgage
definition: A mortgage offered by a private bank or lender that's insured by the Federal Housing Administration

name: Grant
definition: A type of financial aid that doesn't need to be repaid.

name: Gross Income
definition: An individual's total income before taxes and other deductions, or a company's total revenue minus its cost of goods sold.

name: Hard Inquiry
definition: A credit check that lenders pull when reviewing an applicant for a new line of credit.

name: Initial Public Offering (IPO)
definition: When a private company first sells shares of its stock to public investors.

name: Interest
definition: The amount you pay a lender for the privilege of using its money or that a bank pays you on your deposits that is calculated as a percentage of the balance.

name: Inflation
definition: The increase in the prices of goods and services in an economy over time, measured in the US primarily by the Consumer Price Index.

name: Liquidity
definition: The amount of money that is promptly available to meet debts or to use for investment, whether in cash or assets that can be quickly converted to cash.

name: Mortgage
definition: A type of secured loan that is used to purchase a home.

name: Mutual Fund
definition: An investment portfolio that uses a pool of money from large numbers of people to purchase stocks, bonds, or other securities.

name: Net Income
definition: The amount an individual or business makes after deducting costs, allowances, and taxes.

name: Permanent Life Insurance
definition: A policy that lasts your entire life, accrues cash value, and offers a guaranteed death benefit at level premiums.

name: Return on Investments (ROI)
definition: A commonly used measure of profitability calculated by subtracting the cost of an investment from its current value and then dividing by the cost.

name: Social Security
definition: A program run by the federal government and funded by payroll taxes that provides benefits to retirees, their survivors, and workers who become disabled.

name: Stock
definition: An equity security that represents partial ownership of a company.

name: Subsidized Loan
definition: A student loan made by the federal government in which the government will pay the interest on the loan until a grace period of six months after you graduate has expired.

name: W-2 Form
definition: The form you receive from your employer reporting your income, how much tax was withheld, and other information that you use to prepare your income tax return.
